page.title: 09THE CHESTERFIELD CANAL
page.content:
THE CANAL IS ABOUT ONE KILOMETRE SOUTH OF SOUTH ANSTON,IN A VALLEY BETWEEN THE VILLAGE AND THORPE SALVIN. THE CANAL WAS OPENED IN 1777 AND WAS DESIGNED BY JAMES BRINDLEY. IT IS NOW DISUSED.
IT IS POSSIBLE TO WALK IN QUIET COUNTRYSIDE FROM KIVETON PARK TO SHIREOAKS
THE CANAL IS A PEACEFUL,QUIET SORT OF PLACE,JUST ABOUT THE ONLY NOISE IS THE BIRDS. SOME PEOPLE LIKE THE CANAL AS IT IS,BUT OTHER PEOPLE WOULD LIKE TO OPEN IT AGAIN,WITH CANAL BOATS.
I HAVE MIXED FEELINGS ABOUT THE CANAL, BUT MOSTLY I WANT IT TO STAY THE SAME.
FAY BARLEY CLASS ONE
